slides.title: <mark>5 Weekly Check-Ins</mark> That Keep You Honest

slides.body:
Clarity doesn’t come from motion.

It comes from reflection and adjustment.

Here are <mark>5 simple questions</mark> to review your week wisely:

slides.title: <mark>What went well?</mark>
slides.body:
Start with the wins—no matter how small.

List three things that worked.
Identify one pattern to repeat.
Say “thank you, effort” to yourself.

Gratitude and data lift your mindset and inform your next plan.

slides.title: <mark>What didn’t?</mark>
slides.body:
Name the miss without blame.

Pick one lesson and one course correction.
Write the new rule you’ll follow.

Fail fast, learn once, move forward.

slides.title: <mark>Where did my time go?</mark>
slides.body:
Audit the 168 hours.

List top three time sinks—include email, meetings, and scrolling.
Decide what to stop, shorten, or delegate.

Ownership of your schedule is ownership of your life.

slides.title: <mark>Am I aligned with my goal?</mark>
slides.body:
Check the needle against intention.

State the one outcome you want this month.
Score the week 0–10.
Identify one micro-step to close the gap.

Alignment is a verb, not a feeling.

slides.title: <mark>What do I need to rest well?</mark>
slides.body:
Plan recovery like you plan work.

Choose sleep bedtime, movement, and offline windows.
Put them in the calendar.
Tell others this is non-negotiable.

Recovery today prevents crisis tomorrow.
Which question will you ask yourself at week’s end?
